docs.lead_paragraph: BANK LIFTS MARKETS JPMorgan Chase became the latest bank to announce strong quarterly profit, and the news helped drive the markets up. But analysts remain wary of the signs of life in the economy as they await the results of stress tests on banks and as foreclosures increase. FOOD SAFETY EFFORTS With the Food and Drug Administration already stretched and food recalls worrying consumers, some sectors of the food industry are paying other government agencies to make sure products are safely handled. [A1.]

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 2:56 p.m. | Gov. David A. Paterson on Thursday announced that he would introduce a bill to legalize same-sex marriage, drawing on the soaring oratory of the civil rights movement to call on the Legislature to add New York to the four states that have already authorized such unions.
docs.abstract: The governor drew on the soaring oratory of the civil rights movement to call on the Legislature to add New York to the four states that have already authorized such unions.

docs.lead_paragraph: SOUTH ORANGE -- Village officials and leaders of the public employees' union have agreed on a proposal to avert 11 of the 14 planned layoffs. The deal calls on municipal employees to increase their contribution to health insurance payments and take 12 unpaid furlough days before the end of 2010, according to a union official.

headline.main: A Plan to Avert Layoffs in South Orange

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is drawing up plans to disclose the conditions of the 19 biggest banks in the country, as it tries to restore confidence in the financial system without unnerving investors, The New York Times's David E. Sanger and Eric Dash report, citing senior administration officials.

headline.main: U.S. Plans to Reveal Data on Health of Top Banks
